Key Match Events: The Nuggets improved to 9-2 when Russell Westbrook is in the starting lineup with Wednesday’s win over the Atlanta Hawks.
Westbrook is averaging 12.8 points and nine assists in the four games since rejoining the starting lineup.
Of Westbrook’s 11 assists against Atlanta, Jokic was on the scoring end of three of them.
Westbrook was also on the finishing end on three of Jokic’s 15 assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Westbrook said during his on-court interview postgame, 'He’s the best player in the world. My job is to make the game easy for him. He does it for everybody else. It’s a pleasure to be able to share the floor with him.'

Malone said, 'Russ, I know for a fact, has done it all year long. He’s the one guy that will talk, but I want (the rest of) them to take ownership. I want them to hold each other accountable, police each other, because when that happens, then you have a chance to be special.'

Christian Braun said, 'A big part of why we’ve been so good, especially these last few games, is Russ running in transition. It kind of shocked me how good of a passer he was. I knew he was a good passer. I didn’t know he was this good. He plays off Nikola really well. He finds me in transition a ton. He’s been great for us.'
